text:
Charly, gracias. Solo hago esto para entender cómo funciona TWeb.
Me gusta cuando sé cómo funciona internamente.

Creo que los expertos a menudo no entienden qué problemas tiene un principiante.
Una cosa es segura de que es difícil crear una aplicación grande sin un FRAMEWORK correspondiente (TWeb, Beacon, MVC o lo que sea).

text: is that bootstrap?
yes
An CSS

`/* Section */`
`.section {`
  `clear: both;`
  `margin: 0px;`
  `padding: 0px;`
`}`
`/* Column */`
`.col {`
  `background: #eee;`
  `display: block;`
  `float:left;`
  `margin: 1% 0 1% 1.6%;`
`}`
`.col:first-child { margin-left: 0 !important; }`

`/* Row */`
`.row:before,`
`.row:after { content:""; display:table; }`
`.row:after { clear:both;}`
`.row { zoom:1; /* For IE 6/7 */ }`

`/* Grid */`
`.grid_1_of_8{ width: 11.1% }.grid_2_of_8{ width: 23.8% }.grid_3_of_8{ width: 36.5% }.grid_4_of_8{ width: 49.2% }.grid_5_of_8{ width: 61.9% }.grid_6_of_8{ width: 74.6% }.grid_7_of_8{ width: 87.3% }.grid_8_of_8{ width: 100% }`
`/* Full Width below 768 pixels */`
`@media only screen and (max-width: 768px) {`
  `.col {  margin: 1% 0 1% 0%; }`
  `[class*='grid_'] { width: 100%; }`
`}`

text: Charly, I can set up the browser depending of the device.

elements.text: Charly, I can set up the browser depending of the device.

text: Do you think there is a possibility to detect different setups when changing the web browser size?

elements.text: Do you think there is a possibility to detect different setups when changing the web browser size?

text: you should instead use media queries to use different styles for different screen sizes

elements.text: you should instead use media queries to use different styles for different screen sizes

text: Can you give us please an example.

elements.text: Can you give us please an example.

<style>
  /* Normal styles */
  body {
    font-size: 15pt;
    background-color: blue;
  }
  /* Smaller screens */
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    body {
      font-size: 13pt;
      /* Any properties you don't specify will be unchanged */
    }
  }
</style>

text: <https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Media_Queries/Using_media_queries>

attachments.title: Using media queries
attachments.text: Media queries are useful when you want to modify your site or app depending on a device's general type (such as print vs. screen) or specific characteristics and parameters (such as screen resolution or browser viewport width).
attachments.fallback: MDN Web Docs: Using media queries

Pero es permanente si sigue siendo tan simple como es.
Es muy peligroso integrar más y más componentes.

Esto ya no es mantenible para un solo desarrollador.
Actualizaciones cada mes. Luego, estos grandes sistemas se descontinuarán debido a la falta de éxito comercial y su código fuente no tiene valor.

text: it's best to just check if the `User-Agent` header contains `Android` or `iOS`, and maybe a few other similar checks

, and maybe a few other similar checks

text: while some headers are required by certain specifications, others are optional or otherwise dependent on certain things

text: In general, you should do the as little fingerprinting as you possibly can, because the things you depend on might change under the hood
